channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Markets are selling off after the Fed’s Powell said six words investors don’t want to hear: ‘Equity prices are fairly highly valued’
item.description: Investors are wary of any sign that the Fed thinks “irrational exuberance”—as former Fed chair Alan Greenspan once called it—has kicked in.

item.title: LexisNexis exec says it’s ‘a matter of time’ before attorneys lose their licenses over using open-source AI pilots in court
item.description: AI is rapidly being adopted into law firms across the country, and it’s raising stakes for attorneys and their clients alike.

item.title: RFK Jr. Committee’s Decision on Vaccines Much Ado About Nothing (So Far)
item.description: The recent meetings of the Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices change almost nothing about early childhood vaccination. For now.

item.title: The hottest workplace policy at startups right now: No shoes
item.description: Silicon Valley startups are embracing one of their favorite work-from-home perks: attending meetings in just socks.

item.title: Jerome Powell says Congress and the private sector, not the Fed, are responsible for ‘the things that will really matter for future generations’
item.description: Powell is nearing the end of a tumultuous second term.

item.title: Trump administration rehires hundreds of laid-off employees sacked in Musk's cost-cutting blitz
item.description: Hundreds of federal employees who lost their jobs in Elon Musk's cost-cutting blitz are being asked to return to work.
